item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Abandoned car blocking road access and leaking oil, 17th June
item.description:
Abandoned black car with front end crash damage and deployed airbags. Oil fluids leaking from front end of car on to the road surface and blocking access to shared roadway and turning area to multiple properties. Street is a dead end restricting access to vehicles, including emergency vehicles and those with accessibility requirements.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Katherine Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes in Giffard Way., 17th June
item.description:
Looks like the road has been resurfaced up to number 17 then after that several potholes til end of road. Largest one outside number 22. Issue been getting worse for last year or more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Giffard Way, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Overgrown grass and verges- height around 4ft, 17th June
item.description:
The grass and verges have not be cut outside number 1 symphony road since last year. There have been numerous companies cutting grass who have said they do not do that patch. Housing association do not own the patch to cut either. Just today O’Connor (couldn’t see full name) we’re behind the houses cutting minimal grass yet would not touch the huge patch out front or verges.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Symphony Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The series of dropped drains across Station Road from Huntsmen's Meet to Waterside Close, 17th June
item.description:
The series of dropped drains across Station Road running from Huntsmen's Meet to Waterside Close have not been fixed (see ref 5982663 which says it was allegedly fixed on 14 June, these have not been touched). This dropped drains continue to cause severe vibrations in houses bordering the road when large coaches/buses go over them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A loose metal man hole cover which is potentially dangerous and very noisy every time a vehicle passes over it which is frequently each time a car passes over it which is very frequently, 17th June
item.description:
The Manhole is about 5 metres away from the traffic lights at the top of College rd. It is located in the road very close(about 10 cm ) away from the pavement adjacent to" Stirling house" the new conversion of apartments. It is about 2 metres away from a window in Stirling house .A bedroom window. This has already been reported several months ago on the telephone to department responsible for Highways and roads on the council site and although details were noted and promises made no one has got back to me or resolved the situation . This situation jas been ongoing for over a year and a half.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old telephone box (knocked down) obstructing paving and causing health and safety issues. This outstanding issue needs urgent attention and remedy particularly as there is a defibrillator in it which cannot be accessed. I will personally hold the council responsible for any incident which cannot be resolved because of this problem., 17th June
item.description:
The old phone box/kiosk is located in Rotunda Terrace, Montpellier Street, Cheltenham. It has been lying on the pavement for many months. It’s causing a continued problem for pedestrians. It’s an eyesore. It’s dangerous. The defibrillator inside it cannot be accessed. This needs sorting urgently please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement
